semantic_title: Coding of Sepsis and Severe Sepsis Guidelines
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 1. Chapter 1: Certain Infectious and Parasitic Diseases > d. Sepsis, Severe Sepsis, and Septic Shock > 1. Coding of Sepsis and Severe Sepsis > a. Sepsis

content.full_text: For a diagnosis of sepsis, assign the appropriate code for the underlying systemic infection. If the type of infection or causal organism is not further specified, assign code A41.9, Sepsis, unspecified organism. A code from subcategory R65.2, Severe sepsis, should not be assigned unless severe sepsis or an associated acute organ dysfunction is documented. (Evidence: pg no: 23, L59-L62)
content.summary: Basic guidelines for coding sepsis, including when to use unspecified organism codes and when severe sepsis codes should not be used (Evidence: pg no: 23, L59-L62)
key_concepts: Underlying systemic infection coding (Evidence: pg no: 23, L60)
Unspecified organism sepsis (Evidence: pg no: 23, L60-L61)
Severe sepsis coding restrictions (Evidence: pg no: 23, L61-L62)

detailed_rules.rule_text: For a diagnosis of sepsis, assign the appropriate code for the underlying systemic infection (Evidence: pg no: 23, L59-L60)
detailed_rules.explanation: Sepsis coding requires identification and coding of the underlying systemic infection causing the sepsis (Evidence: pg no: 23, L59-L60)

detailed_rules.rule_text: If the type of infection or causal organism is not further specified, assign code A41.9, Sepsis, unspecified organism (Evidence: pg no: 23, L60-L61)
detailed_rules.explanation: When the causative organism or infection type is not documented or specified, use the unspecified sepsis code (Evidence: pg no: 23, L60-L61)

detailed_rules.rule_text: A code from subcategory R65.2, Severe sepsis, should not be assigned unless severe sepsis or an associated acute organ dysfunction is documented (Evidence: pg no: 23, L61-L62)
detailed_rules.explanation: Severe sepsis codes require specific documentation of severe sepsis or acute organ dysfunction, not just sepsis (Evidence: pg no: 23, L61-L62)
